comments.body: @jrgriffiniii  can we get this working sooner vs. later, just in case we become dependent on accepting files in this way from a vendor in the near future? (and thank you so much!!!)
Are we giving them access to our S3 or they want us to ingest from their bucket? Also, who is the vendor?
@tpendragon they would want us to ingest from their bucket. Vendor is Hudson.

Are their S3 buckets publicly available? Or will we have some sort of token, or do they want to provide access to a user we use? Will they put them in the structure we have already? Is it a new bucket per ingest?
the current idea, if and when it comes to it, would be to provide @roelmoon access to a folder in their bucket.

If we have a digitization project with Hudson that can survive a couple weeks from delivery to ingest it might be easier to just start it and implement the feature when we have real files from them to ingest. There's a number of ways this could happen and I'm scared we'd implement the wrong one on accident.

so far we are going with sending the HDs via UPS until it is no longer an option, for one reason or another. as soon as I know that will no longer work, but there are still files that could be sent via other ways (like amazon S3 bucket), Ill let y'all know.
Great! Thanks!
Thank you!!

Locations::HoldingLocation.find_by(code: code); hl.requestable = false; hl.save }

On orangelight run: `Rails.cache.clear`

To get the request button in organgelight for every item:

On Thursday Morning to make this live we will need to ssh to deploy@bibdata1 and run
```
cd /opt/marc_liberation/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Locations::HoldingLocation.where(requestable:false).each{|hl| hl.requestable = true; hl.save}
```

ssh deploy@catalog-prod1 and run
```
cd /opt/orange_light/current
RAILS_ENV=production bundle exec rails c
Rails.cache.clear
```

We have already tested the above changes on bibdata-staging1 and orangelight-staging1

comments.body: We decided not to go this route

pul_solr.title: Only do GraphFilter at index time.

comments.body:
If we create the reindex collection with the staging config set and then change the staging configset later for some other feature, won't it effect production when we don't want it to?

I could split index/query here and have query be the old config for prod?

Hm, I had thought you could update the collection to use a different configset after it had been created, but it looks like that's not true.

Splitting index / query seems like it will help. New stuff will be wonky while the new index is running, but most things will not change.
The only downside is it'll make testing in staging hard. We won't know if it worked until we make it happen for query-time too.

We decided to introduce these changes in a new configset for production use, called `catalog-production-alt`. This will allow us to swap between production configsets whenever we need to reindex due to schema changes. It's been documented in the orangelight indexing doc.

requests.title: Enable Paging for all circulating locations

comments.body: All locations should have a pickup location at Firestone Library, Circulation Desk.  The email should go to the branch location (contact email from https://bibdata.princeton.edu/locations/delivery_locations) and also "fstcirc@princton.edu"

- [ ] Change Pickup Location to always be Firestone instead of Lewis `Pickup location: Lewis Library` (https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/10133617?mfhd=9924175&source=pulsearch)
- [ ] Change the delivery option `Pageable item at Lewis Library, will be delivered to Lewis Library Service desk on first floor.` To be `Pageable item at Firestone Library, will be delivered to Firestone Library Service desk on first floor.` (https://catalog.princeton.edu/requests/10133617?mfhd=9924175&source=pulsearch)

- [ ] Change the email confirmation to say that it is going to be picked up in Firestone
- [ ] Question for Peter Bae: `Items requested before 3:00 pm (weekdays and weekends) will be available for pickup, on the same day` Is this still true?  What is the new delivery expectations?
- [ ] For items that are not currently in Lewis and are Circulating we need to make the `Request this item` button show up For example: https://catalog-staging.princeton.edu/requests/3193478?mfhd=3511881&source=pulsearch

- [ ] Make sure the email request goes to both the branch location (location of book) and the firestone circulation desk. 

- [ ] Make sure Firestone Library only gets one email

Message for the patron confirmation email: 

"Your request to pick this item up has been received. We will process the requests as soon as possible, but given the demand and the current circumstances some delay may occur. You will receive an email the day prior telling you the item will be available for pickup in Firestone Lobby between the hours of 12-2."
